Tomato Early Blight.precautions: Spray in morning, avoid direct sunlight. Wear protective gloves and mask.

Tomato Late Blight.precautions: Apply before rain. Do not apply during flowering. Wait 7 days before harvest.

Tomato Leaf Mold.precautions: Improve air circulation. Spray on both sides of leaves. Avoid high humidity.

Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot.precautions: Remove infected leaves first. Spray every 7-10 days. Avoid overhead watering.

Tomato Spider Mites.precautions: Spray under leaves where mites hide. Apply in early morning. Repeat after 5 days.

Tomato Target Spot.precautions: Remove affected leaves. Apply preventively. Do not exceed recommended dosage.

Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.precautions: Remove infected plants immediately. Control whiteflies. Use resistant varieties.

Tomato Mosaic Virus.precautions: Remove infected plants. Disinfect tools. Use virus-free seeds. Control aphids.

Potato Early Blight.precautions: Start spraying when plants are 6 inches tall. Repeat every 7-10 days.

Potato Late Blight.precautions: Critical to apply before disease appears. Monitor weather conditions. Remove infected tubers.

Pepper Bell Bacterial Spot.precautions: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid working in wet fields.

Corn Common Rust.precautions: Apply at first sign of disease. Ensure good coverage. Do not apply during tasseling.

Corn Gray Leaf Spot.precautions: Apply when disease first appears. Rotate crops. Remove crop residue.

Apple Scab.precautions: Apply before bud break. Continue until petal fall. Remove fallen leaves in autumn.

Apple Black Rot.precautions: Prune infected branches. Remove mummified fruits. Apply during bloom period.

Apple Cedar Rust.precautions: Remove nearby cedar trees if possible. Apply during pink bud stage. Repeat after rain.

Cherry Powdery Mildew.precautions: Improve air circulation. Apply at first sign. Avoid high nitrogen fertilizers.

Grape Black Rot.precautions: Apply from bud break to 4 weeks after bloom. Remove infected clusters. Prune properly.

Grape Esca.precautions: Remove infected vines. Avoid pruning wounds. Use disease-free planting material.

Strawberry Leaf Scorch.precautions: Remove old leaves after harvest. Apply in early spring. Maintain good air circulation.
